intro: Thlaspi arnaudiae, commonly known as the Arnaud's cress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous species native to the high-altitude regions of the Pyrenees in France. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has palmate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, mountainous climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
